title: Religious Worker visa (subclass 428)
summary: This page provides detailed information about the Religious Worker visa (subclass 428), which is closed to new applications. It outlines the rights and obligations of existing visa holders as well as the responsibilities of approved sponsors. It also explains conditions, sponsorship rules, record‑keeping, and requirements for both visa holders and sponsoring organizations.

visa_info.description: A visa for religious workers allowing temporary stay and sponsored employment in Australia.
visa_info.application_availability: Applicants cannot apply for this visa.
visa_info.alternative_option: Use the visa finder tool to search for an appropriate visa.

current_visa_holders.rights_and_obligations_info: Information applies only to individuals already granted a Religious Worker visa (subclass 428).
current_visa_holders.vevo_access: Visa holders can use VEVO for free to check visa details and entitlements.

visa_validity.typical_validity: Valid for the period of the nominated position

visa_allows: Work full‑time as a religious worker for the sponsoring religious institution
Stay in Australia for the period of the nominated position (maximum 2 years)
Bring family members (who can work and study)
Leave and re-enter Australia multiple times while the visa is valid
holder_obligations: Comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws
Not be involved in disruptive or violent activities threatening harm to the Australian community or groups within it

prohibited_actions: Stopping work for the sponsoring employer
Engaging in work inconsistent with the nominated position
Working for another person or for oneself while employed by the sponsor

if_stop_working_for_sponsor: Be sponsored by another organisation to stay in Australia

requirements: No need for a new visa unless it is close to expiry
Must be nominated by a proposed new sponsor
Nomination must be approved before starting the position
changing_sponsor.if_visa_close_to_expiry: Use the visa finder tool to identify an appropriate visa.

family_obligations.entry_conditions: Family cannot enter Australia before the primary visa holder.
family_obligations.departure_conditions: Family must leave Australia when the visa ends.
ongoing_obligations: Remain a member of the family unit
permitted_activities: Family members can work or study while the visa is valid

changes_to_report: Changes to phone number, email, address, or passport
mandatory_notifications.consequences_of_not_providing_passport_d: Significant delays at the airport and possible denial of permission to board a plane.

sponsor_information.eligible_sponsors: Approved sponsors of Religious Worker visa (subclass 428) holders only.
sponsor_information.new_sponsorship_applications: Not permitted, as the visa is closed to new applications.
sponsor_information.vevo_for_organisations: Sponsors can use VEVO for Organisations to check visa details of sponsored individuals.

sponsorship_validity.allowed_activity_during_validity: Sponsor religious workers for a Temporary Activity visa (subclass 408)

post_sponsorship_expiry: Must apply to be approved as a long stay activity sponsor to sponsor applicants for the Temporary Activity visa (subclass 408)
sponsor_information.sponsoring_existing_428_visa_holder: Possible for the remainder of the visa’s validity.

nomination_ceases_on: The day the department receives written withdrawal of the nomination
3 months after sponsor approval ceases (if nomination was granted after sponsor approval)
Day the sponsor approval is cancelled (if nomination approval was given afterward)
Day on which the visa was granted based on the nomination

obligation_list: Notify the department when certain events occur
Provide records and information to the Minister upon request
Not recover, transfer, or charge certain costs to another person
Pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non‑citizen
Ensure the visa holder works in the nominated occupation, program, or activity
Secure reasonable accommodation for the visa holder
Pay travel costs for visa holders to leave Australia
sponsor_obligations.responsibility_note: Sponsors are responsible for all obligations even if another party (e.g., a migration agent) acts on their behalf.

obligation_period.starts: On the day the sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences
obligation_period.ends: Five years after the approved sponsorship or work agreement ceases

required_actions: Not prevent access to individuals with custody of relevant documents
Provide officers access to interview any person on the premises

requirements: Keep records that show compliance with obligations
Some records must be independently verifiable
specific_records: Written requests for payment of outward travel costs (including date received)
Details of how outward travel costs were paid, amounts, for whom, and payment dates

when_required: When determining compliance with sponsorship obligations
When assessing circumstances that could lead to administrative action
must_provide_if: Record is required under Commonwealth, state, or territory law
Record is required to be kept as part of sponsor obligations

obligation_period.starts: When sponsorship is approved or work agreement begins
obligation_period.ends: Two years after sponsorship or work agreement ceases and the sponsor no longer has a sponsored visa holder
